name: ext_R3_TestScript_ruleset
title: Cross-version Extension for R3.TestScript.ruleset for use in FHIR R2
description: This cross-version extension represents TestScript.ruleset from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/TestScript|3.0.2 for use in FHIR R2.

element.short: Assert ruleset used within the test script
element.definition: Contains one or more rules.  Offers a way to group rules so assertions could reference the group of rules and have them all applied.
element.comment: `TestScript.ruleset` has no related element in R2:TestScript

element.short: xml:id (or equivalent in JSON)
element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

element.short: Additional Content defined by implementations
element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.short: Assert ruleset resource reference
element.definition: Reference to the resource (containing the contents of the ruleset needed for assertions).
element.comment: `TestScript.ruleset` has no related element in R2:TestScript

element.short: xml:id (or equivalent in JSON)
element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition should be version specific.  This will ideally be the URI for the Resource Profile defining the extension, with the code for the extension after a #.

element.comment: `TestScript.ruleset` has no related element in R2:TestScript
